page.title: 01DRUMOAK PARISH 1985
page.content: The parish of Drumoak,formerly Dalmaik until the mid nineteenth century,is now part of Kincardine Deeside District in Grampian Region. Roughly triangular in shape it covers an area of 3000 hectares sustaining a population of approximately 750. The famous salmon river,the Dee,forms a Southern boundary with Durris Parish. Mixed{farming}is the main occupation but in recent years massive oil-related {employment}in nearby Aberdeen has resulted in private and public{housing}developments in Drumoak. The area's outstanding antiquity is the ancient Tower of Drum (circa 1280) now part of Drum Castle,owned by the {National Trust}for Scotland. Focal points of modern Drumoak are the Kirk,School,Hall,Pub and housing area.
